column4: good thing ive still got windows. microsoft may be greedy, but at least they make programs that 'just work'
if not nautilus, then why do other burning programs work but nautilus burn does not? explain that
i have told you. here is the forth time: it says please insert blank cd. nothing else that is as far as it takes me i dont get any more dialog
this seems like a lost cause
when i click write it says "please insert blank disk"
that is as far as it goes
it just keeps saying it after clicking ok
media is not bad it is brand new
I had a similar problem trying to burn DVDs in Nautilus .. it was related to permissions.
uhm, don't burn DVDs in Nautilus ;)  I just use the command line or gnomebaker.  It is easier anyway.
I'm not sure I ever tried with CDs.
I'm not sure how to fix it.  Just pointing out that I don't think it is a media problem and that Nautilus CD burning is not 100%.
i know. it is a bug
there is a configuration option for where nautilus puts the temporary data when making the image to burn to the CD .. maybe you don't have permissions there.
I'm at work and not on ubuntu .. its in there somewhere?
